stack wrote:
> Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> 
>  > Sounds like Matt needs a new JMX call: importURIandIncludeInScope(...)
>  > to be able to import URI's just as if they had been in seeds.txt ?
> 
> Marking imports as seeds should have this effect (importUris w/ seed
> flag set).

OK - I didn't notice that

> 
>  >
>  > Is it possible to add URI's as SURT's only (as in seeds.txt /
>  > SURT-scope) ?
>  >
> Not currently.  Is it needed?  (Would only make sense when surt-scope is
> in operation, I'm thinking).

Offcause only when surt-scope is used - and because of the 'seed flag' 
option this is not needed ;-) - I presume that if one want to excend the 
scope with a given SURT-prefix a URL matching that should not be a 
problem to add to the queue

best
Bjarne Andersen
